DOC.brief_summary: A study investigate pharmacokinetics ASP1941 different Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus ( T2DM ) patient different grade renal failure compare T2DM patient normal renal function healthy volunteer .
DOC.criteria: Patient stable type 2 diabetes mellitus healthy subject Subject must predose estimate Glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) value ( Modification diet renal disease ( MDRD ) method ) screening : > 90 ( normal renal function ) 6090 ( mild renal impairment ) 3060 ( moderate renal impairment ) 1530 ( severe renal impairment ) BMI 25.040.0 kg/m2 , inclusive Fasted plasma glucose ( FPG ) < 11.5 mmol/l ( type 2 DM patient ) > 5.6 mmol/l ( Healthy volunteer ) Patients Type 1 diabetes Pulse < 40 > 90 ; SBP > 160 mmHg ; DBP > 100 mmHg T2DM patient stable regimen current medication ( 1 month 5 half life , whichever long ) control disease Healthy Volunteers : Any liver function test upper limit normal T2DM : The liver function test within follow range : AST/ALT : < 2 x ULN Bilirubin : < 1.5 x ULN Alk Phos : < 1.5 x ULN Patients renal impairment history clinically significant illness ( renal disease T2DM associate clinical symptom ) , medical condition , laboratory abnormality within 3 month prior screen Patients renal impairment stable dose concomitant medication least 2 week least 2 week ( 5 halflives , whichever long ) and/or dose change likely occur study Patients T2DM treat diet T2DM patient recent evidence ( e.g within last 6 month ) severe hypoglycemia , example plasma glucose < 3mmol/l ( < 55 mg/dl ) , help others resolve hypo require hospitalization T2DM patient Hemoglobin value < 9 g/dl ( 5.6 mmol/l )
